item.title: Stardew Valley Player Shares Surprising Animal Discovery
item.description:
Highlights

  • Click on animal names in Stardew Valley to quickly change them - a surprising yet useful feature for players.
  • Fans continue to uncover hidden gems in the game, showing the high replayability and dedication to Stardew Valley.
  • Creator Eric "ConcernedApe" Barone's updates keep players engaged, with new content and mechanics awaiting discovery.

In spite of Stardew Valley celebrating its 8-year anniversary this year, players continue to discover unknown features, like the ability to click on animal names to quickly change them. The recent addition of brand-new content in Stardew Valley Update 1.6 has seen fans sharing new gameplay features and mechanics, but the simple yet helpful tip about animal names has come as a pleasant surprise to many in the Stardew Valley community.

Since it first released in 2016, Stardew Valley has become a staple of the life-sim genre, with many praising the simple yet satisfying gameplay, adorable graphics and characters, and expansive lore and worldbuilding. Over the years, the Stardew Valley fandom has compiled hundreds of guides, tips, and tricks to assist new and veteran players, and the recent discovery of an easily overlooked mechanic has shocked longtime fans.

Related
Stardew Valley Fan Suggests New Sprinkler Feature

A Stardew Valley fan comes up with a clever idea utilizing sprinklers, with many players in agreement that it would be a neat feature.

Stardew Valley player GneissGoing was baffled to find that the beloved farming sim allows players to easily change the name of farm animals by simply clicking on their name after interacting with them. Animals in Stardew Valley are crucial to producing valuable goods like milk, cheese, mayonnaise, truffle oil, and more. Players are able to select a name for each animal after purchasing the livestock from Marnie, though some may desire to change the name later on. Many fans previously thought that animal names were permanent, but this latest revelation from GneissGoing has sent diehard Stardew Valley players running to their save files to try out the simple mechanic. Fans have confirmed that the animal name change is available across multiple platforms and versions of the game, and the community has been shocked by how long it took to confirm such a seemingly mundane yet incredibly useful feature.

Stardew Valley Fans Continue To Make New Discoveries

Eric "ConcernedApe" Barone, the creator of Stardew Valley , has released a number of major updates and patches over the years to add more content and fix various bugs, allowing players to enjoy the game to its full potential. Fans have made numerous discoveries with each of these updates, ranging from unique dialogue encounters to rare cutscene events and even new NPC content in Stardew Valley . After eight years, the indie game has managed to keep drawing in players with an incredibly high replayability rate and seemingly endless tidbits to be uncovered.

With Update 1.6 drawing in record player counts for Stardew Valley , it should come as no surprise that players are continuing to experience new changes and encounter overlooked features. As the community shares fun tips and exciting finds, players are unlocking even more secrets within the world of Stardew Valley .

item.title: Super Mario 64 Has Finally Been Beaten Without Using the A Button
item.description:
Highlights

  • Beating Super Mario 64 without using the A button is a remarkable accomplishment that took a Twitch streamer 86 hours to achieve.
  • Marbler had to come up with creative strategies and wait 78 hours for platforms to rise in order to bypass the need to jump.
  • The challenge of completing the game without pressing A has intrigued gamers for 20 years, showing the enduring appeal of Super Mario 64.

A gamer has recently beaten Super Mario 64 without pressing the A button once, completing a community challenge that started around two decades ago. Super Mario 64 is one of the most important platformers ever made, and finishing the game without making Mario jump at least once was a hardcore challenge that puzzled some gamers for a long time.

Super Mario 64 was released in 1996, and quickly became known as one of the best Nintendo 64 games . Tight platforming and amazing level design made Super Mario 64 an unforgettable experience for players in the 90s, and it seemed impossible to even imagine what the game would look like without jumping. However, back in the early 2000s, the game’s community started the Super Mario 64 A Button Challenge, in which gamers tried to go as further as they could in the N64 title without ever jumping. To move around, gamers devised other strategies such as running and diving and pressing B twice to create a fake jump, or pressing Start during other actions to gain altitude. For a long time, it seemed impossible to ever finish the game without pressing A or using mods, though.

Related
Old Footage Shows Luigi in Super Mario 64

Some really old footage of an early build of Super Mario 64 shows that Luigi was planned to be playable in the game before being scrapped.

Now, a Twitch streamer called Marbler has finally completed the Super Mario 64 A Button Challenge by beating the game after 86 hours, as spotted by Games Radar . Around eight months ago, Marbler had almost completed the challenge, jumping only twice. According to Automaton-media , the main issue at the time was during the “Bowser in the Fire Sea” stage, though, when the player needs to grab a pole and then jump from it, pressing A to reach another area. This problem was solved by Marbler by using the Wii Virtual Console version of Super Mario 64 . In this version of the game, the floating platforms on the stage continually rise very slowly, and after three real-life days, they finally reach a level that can be bypassed without pressing A. In Marbler's video, the gamer beat most of the game within a few hours, then waited 78 hours for the platforms to rise, performed a difficult jump, and managed to beat Bowser in the last level, thus achieving the win.

It’s important to acknowledge how much of a challenge beating Super Mario 64 without ever using the A button is. Not only is Super Mario 64 one of the best Super M ario games and was widely played by all kinds of gamers, but people have been trying to pull off this specific challenge for around 20 years.

Super Mario 64 Players Are Still Discovering Secrets In The Game

This was not the only major feat someone recently accomplished in Super Mario 64 , though. Last week, a player opened Super Mario 64 ’s unopenable door for the first time without any mods or hacks. The door was located near Mother Penguin’s house in the Snow World region, and it puzzled the community since 1996, as it seemed impossible to open. However, the player managed to still do it after performing a complicated process that involved grabbing the Mother Penguin’s baby and jumping around.

item.title: Street Fighter 6 Players Discover 2 Secret Super Moves for Akuma
item.description:
Highlights

  • Street Fighter 6 players quickly found two secret Akuma supers, boosting the character's intimidating presence and player count.
  • Despite being cool nods to Akuma's past, the secret moves may not be viable in tournaments due to long taunt animations.
  • With attention turning to future DLC characters, players await unexpected additions in Year 2 from Street Fighter 6.

Street Fighter 6 players have discovered two secret Akuma supers less than a day after the character's release. Akuma is the latest addition to the Street Fighter 6 roster, which has received its biggest update to date.

With the release of the Season 2 patch, Capcom rebalanced all Street Fighter 6 characters . The Street Fighter 6 update made adjustments to mechanics such as Drive Parry and wakeup Drive Reversal, along with changes to reduce the number of missed or accidental special moves. But one of the most eagerly awaited parts of the patch was the arrival of Akuma in Street Fighter 6 , bringing an iteration of the iconic character with an even more intimidating presence. As a result, Akuma's debut made Street Fighter 6 experience a new spike in its player count. And Street Fighter 6 players wasted no time discovering two special tools in Akuma's arsenal.

Related
7 Common Mistakes To Avoid When Playing Street Fighter 6

Street Fighter 6 can be a lot more challenging if players are prone to making mistakes; here are some common ones to avoid.

Street Fighter 6 players have discovered that Akuma has two super secret moves. Despite not being listed in the fighter's move list, players quickly found out about the attacks, as reported by Twitter user DelilahFGC. It all starts by performing Akuma's secret taunt by holding down the six buttons and then smashing them. The demon will start eating a rice ball, and when he's finished, he can perform the ground slam Kongou Kokuretsuzan from Street Fighter 3: Third Strike . The second super secret is Misogi, first seen in Shin Akuma in Capcom vs. SNK 2 . So, while Street Fighter 6 fighters have three super moves , Akuma has seven abilities.

Akuma's Secret Specials in Street Fighter 6 Are Cool, But Not Competitively Viable

While Akuma's super secrets made clever nods to the demon's passages in other games, the possibility of using them in Street Fighter 6 tournaments is questionable. Akuma's secret taunt animation lasts 30 seconds, leaving the fighter with his back turned to his opponent. Despite their inviability in tournaments, now that the super secrets have been discovered, the community is curious to see if any players will attempt the feat with Street Fighter 6 at EVO 2024 .

With the start of Season 2, players' attention also turn to Street Fighter 6 's next DLC characters. Before Akuma, Street Fighter 6 added Rashid and Ed , along with newcomer A.K.I, who became playable after her first appearance in a Street Fighter 5 side story. For Year 2, Street Fighter 6 director Takayuki Nakayama teases the addition of "some unexpected characters," leaving players curious to know what Capcom has in store.

item.title: New Data Reveals Most Popular Games on TikTok
item.description:
Highlights

  • Garena Free Fire is the surprising number one game on TikTok, with a massive 888 billion views across 87.3 million videos.
  • Roblox and Fortnite follow closely behind, with Roblox gearing up for a major event and Fortnite featuring Fallout and possibly Mad Max content.
  • Despite the popularity of games like Call of Duty and Grand Theft Auto, they didn't make the top five list on TikTok, showcasing the diverse range of games on the platform.

TikTok has come a long way over the years, going from primarily hosting videos of teens making choreographed dance routines to a total melting pot of seemingly endless types of content, particularly with video games. Data has recently been revealed of the 500 most popular games on TikTok , courtesy of a platform called mindGAME, with the number one spot taking many by surprise: character shooter Garena Free Fire.

TikTok, at least in the United States, has had quite a tumultuous year thus far. The ultra-popular video platform, owned by Chinese company ByteDance, is facing a nationwide ban after the House of Representatives overwhelmingly voted in favor of a bill which essentially forces the company to sell TikTok to a non-Chinese entity, citing concerns about national security. The company has rebutted with a legal case of its own, as TikTok is suing the US government in response to the bill claiming it to be unconstitutional.

Related
NPC Miles Morales Robbed on TikTok Stream

NPC Miles Morales, who has made his name playing as the video game hero on TikTok, deals with unwelcome robbers during a recent livestream.

Garena Free Fire , for those who may be unaware, is a mobile-based battle royale shooter featuring a similar premise to its popular counterparts such as Call of Duty: Warzone or Fortnite . Although not necessarily as popular as the aforementioned titles in North America, Garena Free Fire is wildly popular in regions like Southeast Asia, with its esports focus lending itself to its massive popularity, once holding the record for the most concurrent viewers for an esports tournament ever. According to the data, Garena Free Fire has 888 billion views across 87.3 million videos on TikTok.

Some of TikTok's most popular video game content is of:

  1. Garena Free Fire
  2. Roblox
  3. Fortnite
  4. Minecraft
  5. PUBG Mobile
  6. Mobile Legends: Bang Bang
  7. PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds (PUBG)
  8. Genshin Impact
  9. Grand Theft Auto V
  10. Call of Duty: Warzone
  11. Five Nights at Freddy's
  12. Brawl Stars
  13. Valorant
  14. Clash Royale
  15. Among Us
  16. League of Legends

Check out the full list here .

Coming in second place is Roblox with 595 billion views on 66 million videos. The ever-popular sandbox title will likely see a surge soon on TikTok, as May 23 is going to be a huge day for Roblox . The date is the official start day for what's being called "The Classic" event, which will see the return of a variety of games, cosmetics and activities from the platform's early years. First launching in 2006, the expansive game has plenty of content to draw from, although exactly which games will be participating has yet to be confirmed.

Fortnite is the third most popular video game on TikTok with 591 million views on 60 million videos. It, too, will probably see a boost in TikTok content in the near future, as the upcoming Fortnite battle royale season will feature Fallout cosmetics , primarily the franchise's legendary Power Armor. While yet to be confirmed, the season is rumored to also feature Mad Max content, likely correlating with the release of the film Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga .

Taking Stock on TikTok

Seemingly popular titles like Call of Duty: Warzone , Grand Theft Auto 5 , and Counter-Strike didn't even make it into the top five, nor did single-player titles like Red Dead Redemption 2 or Elden Ring , which are sitting in the 30-40 range. Some titles have quickly risen up the rankings in recent weeks, like the medieval city-building strategy game Manor Lords , showcasing the surprisingly diversified collection of video games popular on TikTok .

item.title: Helldivers 2 Dev Comments on Whether the Studio Wants to Remain Independent
item.description:
Highlights

  • A surprising success, Helldivers 2 has sold over 12 million copies, leading to server issues and bug fixes post-launch.
  • Arrowhead Game Studios has no plans of being acquired, aiming to grow independently and become a top-tier game studio.
  • New CEO Shams Jorjani aims to elevate the company and focus on creating amazing cooperative experiences like future Helldivers 2 updates.

Helldivers 2 creative director Johan Pilestedt revealed Arrowhead Game Studios currently had no intention of accepting any acquisition offers. In the wake of Helldivers 2 's overwhelming success, its developers have seen their latest PvE shooter rise to the top of the charts as one of publisher PlayStation's best-selling titles to date. However, its financial and critical triumph brought about several questions regarding how the studio would manage the development of the game and what the future has in store for Arrowhead Game Studios as a company.

It's no secret that Helldivers 2 's breakout success was largely a pleasant surprise not only for players but also for developers, who vastly underestimated just how many users would dive into their four-player cooperative shooter and subsequently had to scramble to fix issues with overloaded servers in the days following the title's launch. Since then, Helldivers 2 has sold over 12 million copies , with Arrowhead Game Studios continuing to capitalize on the game's success through updates filled with bug fixes and new content.

Related
Helldivers 2' Devs Discuss Rising Toxicity and Server Strain

Arrowhead Game Studios' chief creative officer discusses Helldivers 2’s growing players' toxicity and server strain as it reaches a larger audience.

Despite the studio's recent success and its intention to grow into a powerhouse for the video game industry, Pilestedt also claimed the studio had no present plans to market itself for an acquisition by a larger company. In an interview with GamesIndustry.biz , the creative director revealed how the developers took pride in their status as an independent studio and that they wanted to see how high they could raise their brand.

Helldivers 2 Developer Hopes The Studio Becomes The Next FromSoftware

Pilestedt additionally expressed his confidence in the Arrowhead Game Studios' new CEO Shams Jorjani . The creative director stated how he hoped the addition of Jorjani's leadership to the business side of the studio would help elevate the company, with Pilestedt believing they had the potential to reach the level of other beloved video game studios, such as FromSoftware and Blizzard.

Jorjani also echoed Pilestedt's message, with the CEO stating that they intended to focus on developing amazing cooperative experiences like with future updates for Helldivers 2 . He claimed he wanted to turn Arrowhead Game Studios into a "flagship studio" where talented creators wanted to work, much like how he himself wanted to join Blizzard in the past. Jorjani additionally revealed the company had no plans to go public and would continue to grow to ensure the quality of its future titles and foster a welcoming workspace.

Arrowhead Game Studios has seen major ups and downs in the past few months, particularly after the massive controversy surrounding the PlayStation Network account linking update, which only ended after Helldivers 2 was delisted from over 170 countries and Sony subsequently backtracked on the requirement. At the time of writing, developers are still fighting for the game's return to all regions. Though Helldivers 2 has since returned to several territories , Arrowhead Game Studios is still mending its wounds from the most recent scandal.
